value.description: The fully-qualified filename of the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Filename

value.description: The password for the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Password

value.description: The Type of the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Type

value.description: The fully-qualified filename of the Truststore
value.name: Truststore Filename

value.description: The password for the Truststore
value.name: Truststore Password

value.description: The Type of the Truststore. Either JKS or PKCS12
value.name: Truststore Type

value.description: The algorithm to use for this SSL context
value.name: SSL Protocol

value.description: The port to listen on for incoming connections
value.name: Port

value.description: The maximum number of cache entries that the cache can hold
value.name: Maximum Cache Entries

value.description: Determines which strategy should be used to evict values from the cache to make room for new entries
value.name: Eviction Strategy

value.description: If specified, the cache will be persisted in the given directory; if not specified, the cache will be in-memory only
value.name: Persistence Directory

value.description: If specified, this service will be used to create an SSL Context that will be used to secure communications; if not specified, communications will not be secure
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Base path for incoming connections
value.name: Base Path

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming connections
value.name: Listening Port

entry.key: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The maximum amount of data to receive per second; this allows the bandwidth to be throttled to a specified data rate; if not specified, the data rate is not throttled
value.displayName: Max Data to Receive per Second
value.name: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: A Regular Expression to apply against the Distinguished Name of incoming connections. If the Pattern does not match the DN, the connection will be refused.
value.name: Authorized DN Pattern

value.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a FlowFile to be confirmed before it is removed from the cache
value.name: Max Unconfirmed Flowfile Time

entry.key: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

value.description: Specifies the Regular Expression that determines the names of HTTP Headers that should be passed along as FlowFile attributes
value.displayName: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)
value.name: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

entry.key: Max Data to Receive per Second
HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

value.description: The name of the server that is running the DistributedMapCacheServer service
value.name: Server Hostname

value.description: The port on the remote server that is to be used when communicating with the DistributedMapCacheServer service
value.name: Server Port

value.description: If specified, indicates the SSL Context Service that is used to communicate with the remote server. If not specified, communications will not be encrypted
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies how long to wait when communicating with the remote server before determining that there is a communications failure if data cannot be sent or received
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value used to identify duplicates; it is this value that is cached
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to get the cached values.
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

value.description: If set, the cache value received will be put into an attribute of the FlowFile instead of a the content of theFlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.
value.name: Put Cache Value In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: If routing the cache value to an attribute of the FlowFile (by setting the "Put Cache Value in attribute" property), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: The Character Set in which the cached value is encoded. This will only be used when routing to an attribute.
value.name: Character Set

referencingComponents.name: FetchDistributedMapCache

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

'Relationship success' is invalid because Relationship 'success' is not connected to any component and is not auto-terminated
'Relationship failure' is invalid because Relationship 'failure' is not connected to any component and is not auto-terminated
'Relationship not-found' is invalid because Relationship 'not-found' is not connected to any component and is not auto-terminated

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming HTTP requests
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: The Hostname to bind to. If not specified, will bind to all hosts
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The SSL Context Service to use in order to secure the server. If specified, the server will accept only HTTPS requests; otherwise, the server will accept only HTTP requests
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: A Regular Expression that specifies the valid HTTP Paths that are allowed in the incoming URL Requests. If this value is specified and the path of the HTTP Requests does not match this Regular Expression, the Processor will respond with a 404: NotFound
value.name: Allowed Paths

value.description: The character set to use for decoding URL parameters if the HTTP Request does not supply one
value.name: Default URL Character Set

value.description: Allow HTTP GET Method
value.name: Allow GET

value.description: Allow HTTP POST Method
value.name: Allow POST

value.description: Allow HTTP HEAD Method

value.description: Allow HTTP OPTIONS Method
value.name: Allow OPTIONS

value.description: A comma-separated list of non-standard HTTP Methods that should be allowed
value.name: Additional HTTP Methods

allowableValues.description: Processor will not authenticate clients. Anyone can communicate with this Processor anonymously
Processor will try to verify the client but if unable to verify will allow the client to communicate anonymously
Processor will reject communications from any client unless the client provides a certificate that is trusted by the TrustStorespecified in the SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies whether or not the Processor should authenticate clients. This value is ignored if the <SSL Context Service> Property is not specified or the SSL Context provided uses only a KeyStore and not a TrustStore.
value.name: Client Authentication

labels.label: Sensor Data proxy and Pass to DMZ cloud
Send Commands out to All Devices

Lookup tables are generated by a process in the SEcloud. These files are send down to the devices to enrich data for prioritisation, these are used to prioritise reports on the data from certain devices.

allowableValues.description: Rate is controlled by counting bytes transferred per time duration.
Rate is controlled by counting flowfiles transferred per time duration
Rate is controlled by accumulating the value of a specified attribute that is transferred per time duration

value.description: Indicates the criteria that is used to control the throughput rate. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Rate Control Criteria

value.description: The maximum rate at which data should pass through this processor. The format of this property is expected to be a positive integer, or a Data Size (such as '1 MB') if Rate Control Criteria is set to 'data rate'.
value.name: Maximum Rate

value.description: The name of an attribute whose values build toward the rate limit if Rate Control Criteria is set to 'attribute value'. The value of the attribute referenced by this property must be a positive long, or the FlowFile will be routed to failure. This value is ignored if Rate Control Criteria is not set to 'attribute value'. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Rate Controlled Attribute

value.description: The amount of time to which the Maximum Rate pertains. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Time Duration

value.description: By default, a single "throttle" is used for all FlowFiles. If this value is specified, a separate throttle is used for each value specified by the attribute with this name. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Grouping Attribute

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to this relationship if they are missing a necessary Rate Controlled Attribute or the attribute is not in the expected format
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are transferred to this relationship under normal conditions
relationships.name: success

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: Known Brokers

value.description: The Kafka Topic of interest
value.name: Topic Name

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.
The <Partition> property will be used to determine the partition. All messages within the same FlowFile will be assigned to the same partition.

value.description: Specifies how messages should be partitioned when sent to Kafka
value.name: Partition Strategy

value.description: Specifies which Kafka Partition to add the message to. If using a message delimiter, all messages in the same FlowFile will be sent to the same partition. If a partition is specified but is not valid, then all messages within the same FlowFile will use the same partition but it remains undefined which partition is used.
value.name: Partition

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: Kafka Key

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka
value.name: Delivery Guarantee

value.description: Specifies the delimiter to use for splitting apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. Note that if messages are delimited and some messages for a given FlowFile are transferred successfully while others are not, the messages will be split into individual FlowFiles, such that those messages that were successfully sent are routed to the 'success' relationship while other messages are sent to the 'failure' relationship.
value.name: Message Delimiter

value.description: The maximum amount of data to buffer in memory before sending to Kafka
value.name: Max Buffer Size

value.description: The maximum size that any individual record can be.
value.name: Max Record Size

value.description: The amount of time to wait for a response from Kafka before determining that there is a communications error
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: The number of messages to send in one batch. The producer will wait until either this number of messages are ready to send or "Queue Buffering Max Time" is reached. NOTE: This property will be ignored unless the 'Message Delimiter' property is specified.
value.name: Async Batch Size

value.description: Maximum time to buffer data before sending to Kafka. For example a setting of 100 ms will try to batch together 100 milliseconds' worth of messages to send at once. This will improve throughput but adds message delivery latency due to the buffering.
value.name: Queue Buffering Max Time

allowableValues.description: Compression will not be used for any topic.
Compress messages using GZIP
Compress messages using Snappy

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: Compression Codec

value.description: Client Name to use when communicating with Kafka
value.name: Client Name

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The hostname of the SMTP host
value.name: SMTP Hostname

value.description: The Port used for SMTP communications
value.name: SMTP Port

value.description: Username for the SMTP account
value.name: SMTP Username

value.description: Password for the SMTP account
value.name: SMTP Password

value.description: Flag indicating whether authentication should be used
value.name: SMTP Auth

value.description: Flag indicating whether TLS should be enabled
value.name: SMTP TLS

value.description: Socket Factory to use for SMTP Connection
value.name: SMTP Socket Factory

value.description: X-Mailer used in the header of the outgoing email
value.name: SMTP X-Mailer Header

value.description: Mime Type used to interpret the contents of the email, such as text/plain or text/html
value.name: Content Type

value.description: Specifies the Email address to use as the sender
value.name: From

value.description: The recipients to include in the To-Line of the email
value.name: To

value.description: The recipients to include in the CC-Line of the email
value.name: CC

value.description: The recipients to include in the BCC-Line of the email
value.name: BCC

value.description: The email subject
value.name: Subject

value.description: The body of the email message
value.name: Message

value.description: Specifies whether or not the FlowFile content should be attached to the email
value.name: Attach File

value.description: Specifies whether or not all FlowFile attributes should be recorded in the body of the email message
value.name: Include All Attributes In Message

relationships.description: FlowFiles that fail to send will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that are successfully sent will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Base path for incoming connections
value.name: Base Path

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming connections
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: The maximum amount of data to receive per second; this allows the bandwidth to be throttled to a specified data rate; if not specified, the data rate is not throttled
value.displayName: Max Data to Receive per Second
value.name: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.name: Authorized DN Pattern

value.name: Max Unconfirmed Flowfile Time

value.displayName: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success
